meanings.definition: A person who writes plays or other dramatic works.
meanings.sent1: The dramaturges carefully crafted the dialogue for the new play.
meanings.sent2: The theater hired talented dramaturges to create captivating scripts.
meanings.sent3: The dramaturges joked that they were the real stars behind the scenes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a team of dramaturges, weaving intricate plots effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The dramaturges' words painted vivid scenes in the audience's minds.

meanings.definition: The art or technique of dramatic composition and the representation of the main elements of drama on the stage.
meanings.sent1: Studying dramaturgy helps one understand the structure of a play.
meanings.sent2: The theater director focused on perfecting the dramaturgy of the performance.
meanings.sent3: The dramaturgy of the play was so well done that it left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to problem-solving was like the dramaturgy of a well-written play.
meanings.sent5: The dramaturgy of the scene created a powerful emotional impact on the viewers.
